message: I have a google code repo that I want to mirror a github repo, how can I do this?
Based on https://convore.com/github/setting-up-mirror-repositories/ you should be able to just email GitHub support to request it.
@jeffl8n thanks but that is the opposite way, i don;t want github to mirror google code, i want google code to mirror github

@italiano40 sorry, I misunderstood the question.  You could try setting up a PostCommitWebHook on Google Code to have GitHub pull the latest code - http://code.google.com/p/support/wiki/PostCommitWebHooks

isn't that still the opposite of what @italiano40 asked for? Perhaps you can set up a git repository on a server somewhere with two remotes -- one to the Google one and another to Github, then periodically pull from Github and push to Google code?
